body_html:
I think the main problem is, our CI runs on the beefiest machines we can find(average 50+ GB memory, 10+ CPUs), and our ci build scripts are optimized for speed on them. We will need to create separate scripts for contributors to perform local testing on real world computers.
…
On Sun, Oct 29, 2017 at 11:31 PM, Charles Shenton ***@***.***> wrote: Thanks for that! I didn't find those when I first googled the problem. I've allocated more memory to docker, and am compiling again now. Assuming that goes fine I'll close the issue. Would it be appropriate if I PRd in a short note on CONTRIBUTING.md? My reasoning is that if there are issues building the CI docker image using default settings on docker for mac, that other people may also run into this issue. — You are receiving this because you commented. I think the main problem is, our CI runs on the beefiest machines we can
find(average 50+ GB memory, 10+ CPUs), and our ci build scripts are
optimized for speed on them.
We will need to create separate scripts for contributors to perform local
testing on real world computers.
…
On Sun, Oct 29, 2017 at 11:31 PM, Charles Shenton ***@***.***> wrote:
 Thanks for that! I didn't find those when I first googled the problem.

 I've allocated more memory to docker, and am compiling again now. Assuming
 that goes fine I'll close the issue.

 Would it be appropriate if I PRd in a short note on CONTRIBUTING.md? My
 reasoning is that if there are issues building the CI docker image using
 default settings on docker for mac, that other people may also run into
 this issue.

 —

body:
I think the main problem is, our CI runs on the beefiest machines we can
find(average 50+ GB memory, 10+ CPUs), and our ci build scripts are
optimized for speed on them.
We will need to create separate scripts for contributors to perform local
testing on real world computers.

On Sun, Oct 29, 2017 at 11:31 PM, Charles Shenton <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Thanks for that! I didn't find those when I first googled the problem.
>
> I've allocated more memory to docker, and am compiling again now. Assuming
> that goes fine I'll close the issue.
>
> Would it be appropriate if I PRd in a short note on CONTRIBUTING.md? My
> reasoning is that if there are issues building the CI docker image using
> default settings on docker for mac, that other people may also run into
> this issue.
>
> —
